title: Box Office Wallows In A Summer Slump, And Some Seek To Find Out Why
teaser: Only one movie in July, Transformers: Age of Extinction, has broken the 100 million mark during its opening weekend. Box office receipts all summer have proven anemic. Paul Dergarabedian, a senior media analyst with RENTRAK, talks to Audie Cornish about the box office slump.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
